result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel M. Snow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:38 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Israel M. Snow in court, in custody with Attorney Karl A Schmidt. Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Obstructing an Officer. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Court orders court costs, to provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharges. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
